title: Skillet Style Onions Requires:  The recipe for Matt Martinez’s “Texas Sprinkle” is in the “Miscellaneous” < “Odds and Ends” folder and the recipe for the “Black Magic Finishing Sauce” is in the “Sauces, Stocks, and Dressings” folder.
instructions: In a plastic container, soak the onions in the salt, water, and vinegar solution for 10 to 15 minutes.  Thoroughly drain the onions and pat them dry with a kitchen towel.

In a large skillet, heat the oil until it’s just smoking (375° F., if you can check its temperature accurately).  Add the onions and sauté them for 30 seconds, then add the “Texas Sprinkle” and cornstarch continue sautéing for an additional 30 seconds.  Lastly, add the “Black Magic Finishing Sauce”, sauté  for 5 to 10 seconds.
Remove the pan from the heat and add the butter.  Continue stirring until the butter is fully melted and incorporated.
remarks: Skillet Style Onions are a side dish with the advantage that it doesn’t have the famous, “Onion Bite”.  It’s an excellent accompaniment for steaks, chicken, and even fish.  It’s also great as a garnish on outdoors grilled hamburgers, where you want to “taste” the full flavor of the grilled meat without masking it with mustard and other typical hamburger ingredients. Yield:  Makes 4 to 6 servings. Source:  Matt Martinez’s Culinary Frontier:  A Real Texas Cookbook, by Matt Martinez, Jr., and Steve Pate, published by Doubleday, 1540 Broadway, New York, N.Y. 10036, © 1997 by Matt Martinez, Jr., and Steve Pate.
